def.socket_io.socketio

Class Socket

  • java.lang.Object
    • def.js.Object
      • def.socket_io.socketio.Socket

  • @Interface
public abstract class Socket
extends def.js.Object
    The socket, which handles our connection for a namespace. NOTE: while we technically extend NodeJS.EventEmitter, we're not putting it here as we have a problem with the emit() event (as it's overridden with a different return)

    • Field Detail

      • nsp

        public Namespace nsp
        The namespace that this socket is for

      • server

        public Server server
        The Server that our namespace is in

      • adapter

        public Adapter adapter
        The Adapter that we use to handle our rooms

      • id

        public String id
        The unique ID for this Socket. Regenerated at every connection. This is also the name of the room that the Socket automatically joins on connection

      • request

        public Object request
        The http.IncomingMessage request sent with the connection. Useful for recovering headers etc

      • client

        public Client client
        The Client associated with this Socket

      • conn

        public Socket.Conn conn
        The underlying Engine.io Socket instance

      • rooms

        public Socket.Rooms rooms
        The list of rooms that this Socket is currently in, where the ID the the room ID

      • connected

        public Boolean connected
        Is the Socket currently connected?

      • disconnected

        public Boolean disconnected
        Is the Socket currently disconnected?

      • handshake

        public Socket.Handshake handshake
        The object used when negociating the handshake

      • json

        public Socket json
        Sets the 'json' flag when emitting an event

      • Volatile

        @Name(value="volatile")
public Socket Volatile
        Sets the 'volatile' flag when emitting an event. Volatile messages are messages that can be dropped because of network issues and the like. Use for high-volume/real-time messages where you don't need to receive *all* of them

      • broadcast

        public Socket broadcast
        Sets the 'broadcast' flag when emitting an event. Broadcasting an event will send it to all the other sockets in the namespace except for yourself

    • Constructor Detail

      • Socket

        public Socket()

    • Method Detail

      • emit

        public Socket emit(String event,
                   Object... args)
        Emits an event to this client. If the 'broadcast' flag was set, this will emit to all other clients, except for this one
        Parameters:
        event - The event that we want to emit
        args - Any number of optional arguments to pass with the event. If the last argument is a function, it will be called as an ack. The ack should take whatever data was sent with the packet
        Returns:
        This Socket

      • to

        public Socket to(String room)
        Targets a room when broadcasting
        Parameters:
        room - The name of the room that we're targeting
        Returns:
        This Socket

      • in

        public Socket in(String room)
        See Also:
        to( room )

      • send

        public Socket send(Object... args)
        Sends a 'message' event
        See Also:
        emit( event, ...args )

      • write

        public Socket write(Object... args)
        See Also:
        send( ...args )

      • join

        public Socket join(String name,
                   Consumer<Object> fn)
        Joins a room. You can join multiple rooms, and by default, on connection, you join a room with the same name as your ID
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the room that we want to join
        fn - An optional callback to call when we've joined the room. It should take an optional parameter, err, of a possible error
        Returns:
        This Socket

      • leave

        public Socket leave(String name,
                    def.js.Function fn)
        Leaves a room
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the room to leave
        fn - An optional callback to call when we've left the room. It should take on optional parameter, err, of a possible error

      • leaveAll

        public void leaveAll()
        Leaves all the rooms that we've joined

      • disconnect

        public Socket disconnect(Boolean close)
        Disconnects this Socket
        Parameters:
        close - If true, also closes the underlying connection
        Returns:
        This Socket

      • on

        public Socket on(String event,
                 def.js.Function fn)
        Adds a listener for a particular event. Calling multiple times will add multiple listeners
        Parameters:
        event - The event that we're listening for
        fn - The function to call when we get the event. Parameters depend on the event in question
        Returns:
        This Socket

      • addListener

        public Socket addListener(String event,
                          def.js.Function fn)
        See Also:
        on( event, fn )

      • once

        public Socket once(String event,
                   def.js.Function fn)
        Adds a listener for a particular event that will be invoked a single time before being automatically removed
        Parameters:
        event - The event that we're listening for
        fn - The function to call when we get the event. Parameters depend on the event in question
        Returns:
        This Socket

      • removeListener

        public Socket removeListener(String event,
                             def.js.Function fn)
        Removes a listener for a particular type of event. This will either remove a specific listener, or all listeners for this type of event
        Parameters:
        event - The event that we want to remove the listener of
        fn - The function to remove, or null if we want to remove all functions
        Returns:
        This Socket

      • removeAllListeners

        public Socket removeAllListeners(String event)
        Removes all event listeners on this object
        Returns:
        This Socket

      • setMaxListeners

        public Socket setMaxListeners(double n)
        Sets the maximum number of listeners this instance can have
        Parameters:
        n - The max number of listeners we can add to this emitter
        Returns:
        This Socket

      • listeners

        public def.js.Function[] listeners(String event)
        Returns all the callbacks for a particular event
        Parameters:
        event - The event that we're looking for the callbacks of
        Returns:
        An array of callback Functions, or an empty array if we don't have any

        public Socket compress(Boolean compress)
        Sets the compress flag
        Parameters:
        compress - If `true`, compresses the sending data

        This Socket

        Parameters:

        fn - An optional callback to call when we've joined the room. It should take an optional parameter, err, of a possible error

        This Socket
